trans-unit.source: Defines a graphic metafile.
A metafile contains records that describe a sequence of graphics operations that can be recorded (constructed) and played back (displayed).
This class is not inheritable.

When you use the <xref:System.Drawing.Image.Save%2A> method to save a graphic image as a Windows Metafile Format (WMF) or Enhanced Metafile Format (EMF) file, the resulting file is saved as a Portable Network Graphics (PNG) file instead.

This behavior occurs because the [!INCLUDE[ndptecgdiplus](~/includes/ndptecgdiplus-md.md)] component of the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] does not have an encoder that you can use to save files as .wmf or .emf files.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.Metafile"></xref> class from the specified data stream.
The <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> from which to create the new <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.Metafile"></xref>.
stream is `null`.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.Metafile"></xref> class from the specified data stream, a Windows handle to a device context, a <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> structure that represents the rectangle that bounds the new <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.Metafile"></xref>, and the supplied unit of measure.
A <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> that contains the data for this <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.Metafile"></xref>.
A Windows handle to a device context.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.RectangleF"></xref> that represents the rectangle that bounds the new <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.Metafile"></xref>.
A that specifies the unit of measure for frameRect.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.Metafile"></xref> class with the specified file name, a Windows handle to a device context, and an <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.EmfType"></xref> enumeration that specifies the format of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.Metafile"></xref>.
A descriptive string can be added, as well.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that represents the file name of the new <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.Metafile"></xref>.
A Windows handle to a device context.
An <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.EmfType"></xref> that specifies the format of the <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.Metafile"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains a descriptive name for the new <xref href="System.Drawing.Imaging.Metafile"></xref>.
